titleStmt.title: Digital description of MS. Laud Or. 157

msItem.author: Abū al-Qāsim Khalaf ibn ʻAbbās al-Zahrāwī, -1013?
msItem.title: Sefer ha-ḥefets ha-shalem (Liber theoricae necnon practicae)
ספר החפץ בשלם
msItem.note: Translated from Arabic by Meshullam ben Yonah at the request of his friend Shalem.
Note in Latin about the content (fol. [ii]r); numerous medical notes in Latin and a Hebrew note (" הספר הזה חברו החכם בגדול המכונה עלזהראוי ") on fol. [iii]r, numerous Hebrew notes on fol. [iii]v.
Numerous marginal and interlinear glosses, notes in Hebrew, some in Latin, chapter numbers in the margin.
Glosses, notes at the beginning (flyleaf) and indexes added at the end (fols. 212r, 215r-217r) in Italian hands.

supportDesc.support: Early Spanish paper with chain-lines spaced 50-55mm apart and zizag signs along the folding line of sheets; outer sheets of quires made of parchment.
supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in both Hebrew (earlier) and Arabic (more recent) numerals.
supportDesc.collation: 14 quires: i 18, ii 14, iii-xi 16, xii 18, xiii 20, xiv 4 Signatures in Hebrew characters, not always visible, no catchwords.
supportDesc.condition: Script faded away on several folios.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather binding, blind-tooled, with the gold-tooled coat of arms of Archbisop Laud in the middle; holes for straps; spine slightly damaged.

history.provenance: Censor's signature: "Dominico Irosolomitano" (fol. 212r); owner's inscription: "Liber Guil[ielmi] Laud Archiepi[scopi] Cant[uariensis] et Cancellar[ii] Universit[atis] Oxon[iensis] 1637" (fol. [iii]v)
history.acquisition: Donated to the Library by Archbishop William Laud (see Summary Catalogue, vol.II, part 1, pp.13-14).

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vol. I, by Adolf Neubauer, Oxford 1886, No. 2120, Catalogue of the Hebrew manuscripts in the Bodleian Library; Supplement of Addenda and Corrigenda to Vol. I, No. 2120, and on the data of the Institute of Microfilmed Hebrew Manuscripts, National Library of Israel with additional enhancements by the cataloguer.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.

listBibl.bibl: Neubauer, Adolf, Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, 1886), no. 2120.

Beit-Arié, Malachi and R.A. May (eds), Catalogue of the Hebrew manuscripts in the Bodleian Library; Supplement of Addenda and Corrigenda to Vol. I (A. Neubauer’s Catalogue) (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1994), no. 2120.

taxonomy.desc: General index of Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vol. ii, by Adolf Neubauer and Arthur Ernest Cowley, Oxford 1906
Catalogue section of Catalogue of the Hebrew Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, vols. i-ii, by Adolf Neubauer, by Adolf Neubauer and Arthur Ernest Cowley, Oxford 1886, 1906
Catalogue of the Institute of Microfilmed Hebrew Manuscripts, Jewish National and University Library, Jerusalem
